subject: Re: [junit] What's the deal with the frog?
msgSnippet: I don t know about the frog, but the slogan comes from the fact that the GUIs for JUnit display a red bar if a test fails and a green bar if all your tests
messageBody:
I don't know about the frog, but the slogan comes from the fact that the
GUIs for JUnit display a red bar if a test fails and a green bar if all
your tests pass. Thus keeping the bar green means your code always passes
the unit tests and is therefore clean.

-Phil




"Kyle Gabhart
<kylegabhart@yah To: junit@yahoogroups.com
oo.com>" cc:
<kylegabhart Subject: [junit] What's the deal with the frog?

02/23/2003 08:17
PM
Please respond
to junit






Hi there,

I love JUnit. It's a great testing framework. What is the deal
though with the frog and the slogan - "keep the bar green to keep the
code clean..."?

Just curious.

Thanks.

-Kyle Gabhart
www.gabhart.com
